title: Manifest
description: The data, parameters and settings needed to present a chart in ParaCharts. @public

datasets.description: The data and parameters needed to present a chart in ParaCharts.

dataset.description: A set of data and parameters needed to present a chart in ParaCharts.

type.description: The type of the chart, such as 'line' or 'column'.

chartTheme.description: What quantities the line chart displays overall. Defaults to the theme of the single series ONLY in single series charts.

facets.description: Metadata describing the axes of the chart.

x.description: Metadata describing the horizontal (x-)axis of the chart.

y.description: Metadata describing the vertical (y-)axis of the chart.

series.description: Metadata, and possibly inline data, describing the series of the chart.

data.description: The source for the data for this dataset.

settings.description: The settings needed to present a chart in ParaCharts.

facet.description: Metadata describing an axis of the chart.

label.description: A text label for the quantity measured by this axis.

variableType.description: Whether the variable this axis measures depends on the variable measured by the other axis.

measure.description: The NOIR data scale of the quantity this axis measures.

datatype.description: The primitive type of the data measured by this axis.

units.description: The units for the dependent axis of the chart, in singular form, if any. This value should be absent if the axis measures a dimensionless quantity. If the units for this axis of the chart are fractional, then this is only the numerator of that fraction.

multiplier.description: The number each record of this axis must be multiplied by to get the true value. Defaults to 1.

denominator.description: If the units for this axis of the chart are fractional, then this is the denominator of that fraction. For example: '(per) capita', '(per) million inhabitants'. If this property is present, then every series on the chart must measure a fractional quantity, of which this will also be the denominator.

minDisplayed.description: The lowest value displayed on this axis of the chart. Defaults to zero for the y-axis and the maximum x-value of any series for the x-axis.

maxDisplayed.description: The highest value label displayed on this axis of the chart. Defaults to the maximum value of any series relative to this axis.

series.description: Metadata, and possibly inline data, describing a series on the chart.

key.description: A unique identifier for the series, which may have spaces, punctuation, or other non-alphanumeric characters that aren't allowed in DOM ids, but which still may not be suitable for the text label.

label.description: The text label for the series, which may be abbreviated or expanded from the series key. Defaults to key.

records.description: The datapoints of this series represented inline.

theme.description: The topic of a series or chart.

baseQuantity.description: The base quantity measured by the series or chart, such as 'item price' or 'inflation rate'.

baseKind.description: What kind of base quantity this is: either a number of things (number), a quantity measured by a unit (dimensioned), a rate of change (rate), or a proportion of a whole (proportion).

locale.description: The particular location that the quantity measured by this series or chart is limited to, if any.

entity.description: The singular, definite entity the quantity measured by this series or chart belongs to, if any.

items.description: The multiple, indefinite items the quantity measured by this series or chart belongs to, if any.

aggregate.description: The statistical aggregate measured by this series or chart, such as 'total' or 'estimated', if any.

x.description: The location of the point on the x-axis.

y.description: The location of the point on the y-axis.

data.description: The source for the data of a dataset.

source.description: Whether the data is inline or sourced externally.

path.description: The location of the external data file.
path.$comment: Additional validation?: check path is a URL or a relative path.

format.description: The format of the data file.
format.$comment: Additional validation?: check format is a MIME type.

settings.description: The settings needed to present a chart in ParaCharts.

sonification.isEnabled.description: Whether sonification is enabled for this chart. Defaults to true.

aspectRatio.description: The ratio of the height to the width of the chart on the screen (i.e. x-axis size / y-axis size). Defaults to 1 (i.e. a square chart).
